title: Chapter 613: 556: Thank You
body:
Chapter 613: 556: Thank You



Chapter 613: Chapter 556: Thank you

As the full moon banquet was nearing its end, security from Doomsday Hotel went to find Charlotte Lane, as there was a woman outside who wanted to see her.

“What’s her name?” Kevin Clark asked.

“She said her surname is Zheng,” the security guard said. “She’s been lingering at the hotel entrance for a while. Our staff approached her, and she asked to see the young lady.”

Charlotte Lane and Kevin Clark exchanged glances: “I’ll take a look.”

“I’ll accompany you.”

Both went to the entrance.

The woman was standing with her back to the entrance. When she heard the footsteps, she turned to look at them.

After turning around, Charlotte Lane and Kevin Clark stopped to look at her.

The woman was wearing a long dress, with long hair over her shoulders, and a blue flower hairpin on her right ear. Upon seeing them, she smiled and said, “It’s been a long time since I last saw you two.”

Charlotte Lane and Kevin Clark looked at the woman in front of them.

Although they didn’t show it on their faces, both were somewhat nostalgic in their hearts.



It was the woman who was used 319 in the Spotlight Gala years ago and was bullied by those people.

At that time, Charlotte Lane promised her that she would definitely save her.

Charlotte Lane didn’t break her promise.

“Long time no see,” said Charlotte Lane.

Miss Sawyer said, “I really wanted to see you long before, but at that time you were pregnant, and I didn’t know where to find you. Today, I saw the news online and thought I’d try my luck here.”

“Let’s go upstairs and sit down,” said Charlotte Lane.

Miss Sawyer nodded.

They went upstairs and found a quiet place, and Kevin Clark left.

Sitting across from each other, Charlotte Lane asked, “Has your body fully recovered?”

“Yes,” Miss Sawyer said, “It’s completely healed. Thank you.”

Charlotte Lane shook her head.

“I really want to thank you,” Miss Sawyer said. “At that time, I didn’t want to live anymore, but you pulled me back. That’s why I can sit here now and still see the countless sceneries of this world.”

“There’s nothing you can’t get through,” Charlotte Lane said. “As long as you stay alive, things will always get better.”

“I believe that now,” Miss Sawyer said. “When I think back to what happened before, it feels like a dream. After waking up, it’s just a dream. Compared to my life, it doesn’t even account for a fraction of it. My good life shouldn’t be ruined by this little thing.”

Charlotte Lane looked at her, listening to her words, her fingers rubbing the table.



Charlotte Lane glanced at the slender fingers around Luke’s arm and asked, “Can we come in?”

“Yes,” Luke opened the door a little wider.

Only then did Kevin Clark see the girl grabbing Luke’s arm.

He was taken aback.

The girl’s appearance was very similar to Charlotte Lane’s.

She wasn’t as stunning as Charlotte Lane, nor did she have the cold demeanor.

The girl looked at them, her grip on Luke’s arm tightened, and her eyes seemed a little frightened.



Yet she just pursed her lips tightly, standing next to Luke and watching them without any excessive reaction.

Charlotte Lane glanced at her, held back her gaze for fear of scaring her.

It was indeed similar, even she herself thought they were alike.

It was because they looked alike that Edward Kirsten abducted and drove her insane.

Once inside the room, Kevin Clark and Charlotte Lane sat on the sofa.

Meanwhile, Luke took the girl back to the room.

Charlotte Lane sat thoughtfully as she heard Luke say, “Be good and stay here, count to one hundred and I’ll come back.”

“Okay,” the girl’s voice was very gentle and soft.

But, as soon as Luke turned around and was about to close the door, the girl suddenly spoke up quickly, “One hundred, I’m done counting.”

Luke paused as he was closing the door: “......”

Outside, Charlotte Lane raised her eyebrows.

Kevin Clark furrowed his brows, feeling something was off.

“Be good, I have something to discuss,” Luke said patiently. “I’ll take you to have cotton candy later.”



“Count to one hundred?” The girl asked.

“Count to three hundred,” Luke suddenly changed his mind.

The girl looked at him without saying a word.

“Three hundred. I’ll buy you two.” Luke added.

“Okay,” the girl agreed again.

That was when Luke successfully closed the door.
